news.title: Rats! Why virtual reality doesn't feel 'real'
news.summary:
Have you ever noticed that even detailed, sophisticated virtual reality experiences don’t feel completely “real”?

It all comes down to your inner ear – and a study published earlier this month using rats may help explain why this is the case.

wikipedia.title: Spatial memory
wikipedia.summary: In cognitive psychology and neuroscience, spatial memory is the part of memory responsible for recording information about one's environment and its spatial orientation.

wikipedia.title: Hippocampal formation
wikipedia.summary: The hippocampal formation is a compound structure in the medial temporal lobe of the brain.

wikipedia.title: T-maze
wikipedia.summary: In behavioral science, a T-maze (or the variant Y-maze) is a simple maze used in animal cognition experiments.
